findings.title: EN-03 Unnecessary Type Casting
findings.description: The contract contains an unnecessary type casting where `tokenIn` is explicitly cast to an address, even though `tokenIn` is already of type address.

findings.title: CR-01 Incorrect Usage of Initializer Modifier in Upgradable Contract
findings.description: The contract utilizes an initializer modifier in both the constructor and an initialize() function, causing initialization logic to run only once at deployment, leading to a loss of functionality and issues in managing the contract state.

findings.title: ME-01 Denial Of Service Because of Invalid Token Addresses
findings.description: The `setTokenAddress()` function allows an account with the `ACONCAGUA_ROLE` role to set the address associated with a specific token symbol, posing a risk to the integrity of contract operations.

findings.title: ME-02 Role Revocation
findings.description: The current implementation of the smart contract allows any member of a role group to revoke role membership of others within the same group, enabling any admin to unilaterally grant or revoke access to significant functionalities, potentially leading to unauthorized access or denial of service.

findings.title: MI-01 Floating Solidity Pragma
findings.description: The smart contracts use a floating Solidity pragma, which implies they are not bound to a specific compiler version, posing potential risks for contracts deployed in live environments.

findings.title: MI-02 Manipulation of Start Time Period by Aconcagua Role
findings.description: The setStartTimePeriod() function can be called by an admin with Aconcagua role at any moment, even after the start time of the period has been initiated, potentially affecting interactions or strategies.

findings.title: EN-05 Implementation of Automated Testing
findings.description: The project lacks a comprehensive automated testing system, potentially allowing errors and vulnerabilities to go undetected.
